game_name: The Curious Tale of the Stolen Pets
game_description: **Playable with Hand Tracking! Help your grandfather solve the mystery of the stolen pets by solving puzzles in wonderful miniature worlds crafted from the ground up for VR. Every world is unique, full of interactions and colorful life. A HEART-WARMING TALE Guided by the voice of your grandfather, travel back to the imaginative adventures of your childhood and the worlds you created together. Revisit a joyful past and the troubled relationship with your sister. PEACEFUL PUZZLING Proceed through the game by solving light puzzles using your hands; Grip, push, drop and spin the numerous interactive elements. Every world is full of vibrant life. WORLDS OF HIDDEN WONDER Peek behind a glowing volcano in the prehistoric setting or lean in to investigate your old summer cottage. Explore incredibly detailed and handcrafted worlds while enjoying gameplay tailor-made for VR.
Languages: English, Chinese (China), French (France), German, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Portuguese (Brazil), Russian, Spanish (Mexico), Spanish (Spain)
review_1: IT was what I was hoping for, ie something like that other game on steam whose name I cant recall, but you , Shopping Trip to Eklan Tor, that was the game I was hoping this game would resemble It more or less does, but its more mure 'kids movie' than I was hoping, with too much narration and stuff, but still, the actual game play (giant hunting for clues on a space island) is quite good, and has some decent puzzle aspects as well. Good job.
review_2: My 8yos and 5yo really had fun taking turns playing this game. Great for casting to the TV so everyone can have join in and make suggestions. Some of the puzzles can be tricky for little ones. The graphics are simple, cartoony and perfect for this style of game. The music by Wintergarten is also perfect. I also love that they integrated hand tracking, though not all controls are available when you just have hands. I would like it if there were some more finger tracking options like thumb to middle finger for re centre view or something. But yeah, it's a great game!
review_3: Such a cute game. I love it and my 6 year old loves it.
review_4: The game give me a super relax and chilling feeling. I was so happy when I played this because everything was so cute and kinda remind me of my childhood. The only down thing was it so short and I wish it would have a second part!
review_5: Very sweet and charming, although very short. Stick with controllers for this game, the hand tracking is too frustrating. These worlds need to be rotated and no gesture seems to work any better than 1/10 times to make it rotate.
